p: Other tests available for hepatitis C detection and diagnosis include the HCV core antigen test [ 46] and core antigen/antibody tests [ 47]. These tests are available only in some countries. While the HCV core antigen test is sensitive, will yield results early in the course of infection, and detects active infection [ 46, 48], the HCV core antigen/antibody test is positive in the presence of either one or both antigen and antibody [ 47] making it difficult to differentiate between active and resolved infection. Blood donations are screened by testing for HCV RNA and core antigen [ 49].
